title: In Memory of Lena Kourkoutis and Her Unfinished Work
content: Lena Fitting and her twin sister Sylvia were born in Rostock, East Germany on June 6, 1979. When they were six years old, her family moved to Eritrea so the children could experience life outside the Soviet Union, where her father taught physics at the university in Asmara. In 1988, with the civil war heating up, the family moved back to Rostock. The fall of the Berlin wall in 1989 and the subsequent reunification of Germany opened new opportunities. These formative experiences may have helped reinforce Lenaâ€™s strong sense of fairness and her willingness to speak up on behalf of students, staff and colleagues when things needed to be addressed. Lena attended the University of Rostock for her undergraduate diplom in physics from 1997-2003, and a Fulbright Fellowship supporting her studies at the North Carolina State University in Raleigh, NC from 2002-2003.
